ðŸ’¡ shellwright | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable AI agents and LLMs to automate, record, and capture visual output from command-line interfaces and terminal applications.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-driven terminal automation â€¢ Terminal session recording (video) â€¢ Screenshot capture of terminal actions â€¢ MCP server for LLM/agent integration â€¢ Playwright-like capabilities for the shell
ðŸ“– Summary: Shellwright is a tool that brings Playwright's capabilities to the command line, enabling AI-driven terminal automation, recording of terminal sessions as videos, and taking screenshots. It acts as an MCP (Model Context Protocol) server, allowing LLMs and agents to interact with and control terminal applications.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ netronome | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring and analyzing network performance, including speed, packet loss, and server health, with capabilities for distributed environments and automated alerting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Speed Testing (Speedtest.net, iperf3, LibreSpeed) â€¢ Network Diagnostics (Traceroute, MTR) â€¢ Distributed Server Monitoring (Agents) â€¢ Automated Alerting
ðŸ“– Summary: Netronome is a Go-based network performance monitoring tool that offers speed testing, packet loss monitoring, and distributed server monitoring through lightweight agents. It provides real-time metrics, historical data, and automated alerts via an intuitive web interface, designed for simple deployment and low resource usage.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ ScanKDea | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Network security scanning and reconnaissance for ethical hacking and security audits.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fast and efficient port scanning (TCP Connect, SYN, UDP, Stealth, Full) â€¢ Automatic detection of common services and banner grabbing â€¢ Signature-based operating system detection â€¢ Scanning of IP ranges (CIDR) and custom port lists â€¢ Multi-threading for rapid scans
ðŸ“– Summary: ScanKDea is an advanced Python-based security scanner designed for cybersecurity professionals and ethical hackers. It provides features for port scanning, service detection, OS fingerprinting, and basic vulnerability analysis.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ BrutDroid | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating the setup of Android mobile penetration testing environments within Android Studio.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Windows & Android Studio Optimized â€¢ One-Click Rooting â€¢ Burp Suite Integration â€¢ Custom Frida Scripts â€¢ Vibrant New UI
ðŸ“– Summary: BrutDroid is a Windows-optimized toolkit for Android Studio that automates the setup of mobile penetration testing environments. It simplifies emulator creation, rooting, Frida server deployment, and Burp Suite certificate installation, allowing security researchers to focus on testing.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Open-Interface | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a hands-free, natural language interface for controlling computer operations and automating tasks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-drives computer using LLM backend (GPT-4o, Gemini, etc.) â€¢ Automatically executes steps by simulating keyboard and mouse input â€¢ Course-corrects using updated screenshots of progress â€¢ Supports macOS, Linux, and Windows
ðŸ“– Summary: Open Interface is a Python-based tool that enables users to control their computers using natural language commands processed by Large Language Models (LLMs). It translates user requests into a series of automated keyboard and mouse actions, and uses screenshots to course-correct its execution.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
